fields.description:
The JIRA {{SearchProvider}} allows unbounded searches, which often leads to {{OutOfMemoryError}}. OOME's of this sort regularly bring down Atlassian's public and internal instances.

It usually comes down to a plugin having code like this:

{code}
Collection<Issue> issueResults = searchService.search(user, query, PagerFilter.getUnlimitedFilter()).getIssues();
{code}

This code has the potential to bring tens of thousands of issues into memory, eventually leading to the OOME.

JIRA already has a {{jira.search.views.max.limit}}, which the issue navigator and the REST api both use, exactly to avoid this type of situation.

{code}
<property>
    <!--
        Whether search results are capped to a hard limit, otherwise return a 403 (Forbidden) to the client.
        Set this to negative (-1) or empty for unlimited results.
        NOTE: this must be EQUAL TO OR GREATER THAN jira.search.views.default.max above, otherwise all Issue Navigator links will fail with a 403
    -->
    <key>jira.search.views.max.limit</key>
    <default-value>1000</default-value>
    <type>uint</type>
    <user-editable>false</user-editable>
</property>
{code}

We should apply this limit to the SearchProvider as well (i.e. even if you request a bazillion, you get at most {{jira.search.views.max.limit}}).
fields.summary: JIRA SearchProvider allows unbounded Lucene searches, which causes OutOfMemoryError

fields.description:
It is possible to adjust global and project specific permissions such that the drop-down to select comment restrictions is empty and thus not displayed.

This leads to a javascript error and the user is presented a popup saying:
"This page is asking you to confirm that you want to leave - data you have entered may not be saved. Leave Page Stay on Page" (FF 14/Linux)

The issue can be reproduced as follows:
- install standalone 5.1.1 x64 linux (as non-root)
- create a humble user with membership only in jira-users
- create a project and set its Users role to jira-developers
- adjust permission settings as follows:
-- Browse Issues: add jira-users
-- Add Comment: add jira-users
- create an issue in the created project
- login and add a comment with the humble user to the created issue
=> Dialog appears and user has to click 'Leave Page' to add the comment

Workaround:
- In Global Settings, switch Comment visibility from 'Project Roles only' to 'Groups & Project roles'

JavaScript error looks as follows in Chrome Developer Tools:
{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'split' of undefined
commentForm.getCommentVisibility in jira.webresources:viewissue-components.js:70
commentForm.ajaxSubmit in jira.webresources:viewissue-components.js:70
commentDrawer.ajaxSubmit in jira.webresources:viewissue-components.js:70
$.delegate.delegate.delegate.delegate.delegate.delegate.delegate.delegate.delegate.delegate.bind.bind.bind.bind.preventEscClosingComments in jira.webresources:viewissue-components.js:70
f.event.dispatch in batch.js:3
f.event.add.h.handle.i in batch.js:3
{code}

Note that the behavior is not reproducible in a development environment (e.g. using atlas-run from a bare bone jira5 plugin directory)
fields.summary: Missing Comments Restricting Drop-Down leads to JavaScript error

fields.description:
When calling the issue resource via REST API (POST) you'll always get HTTP 400 error.

The error raised is 

issuetype:"issue type is required"

even if the issuetype has been obviously specified in the call.

The problem is caused by an utf accent present in the issuetype name eg. "Attività" in the json structure.
Removing the accent (making the issuetype name "Attivita") solved the problem.

I've also changed the issuetype name in Jira to "Attivita" to match the one sent via POST call.

It seems that the REST API is unable to handle UTF accents properly while Jira does.
fields.summary: Issuetype with utf character à generates a HTTP 400 "issue type is required" error when calling REST issue resource via POST

fields.description:
With a browser window of width ~1150 pixels, the text in the "Operations" column in the Group browser is wrapped oddly:

!withouttweaks.png!

The HTML looks like this:

{code:xml}
<thead>
    <tr>
        <th width="40%">
            Group Name
        </th>
        <th width="20%">
            Users
        </th>
        <th width="30%">
            Permission Schemes
        </th>
        <th width="10%">
            Operations
        </th>
    </tr>
</thead>
{code}

By changing the "Users" width down to 10% and bumping the "Operations" width up to 20%, it looks much better, even with a large number in the Users column:

!withtweaks.png!

This occurs in the latest versions of Safari, Firefox, and Chrome.
fields.summary: "Operations" column on Groups page in OnDemand wraps weirdly on anything but really wide browser windows

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29161].
  {panel}

Idea taken from here [https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=154633652]

Support often takes data from customers where there's still a bit of overhead and time involved in getting the data from the customer to a working state in support.

What currently happends:
* Support needs to convince customers that our [data anonymizer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=154633652] is safe enough for them to trust (it really isn't)
* Customer follows that guide (sometimes with difficulty, needing more bounces) and attaches the backup
* Support needs to restore the backup locally
** Turn off emailing
** Worry about CDATA cleaning
** Change the passwords to sphere
** Change any cwd_directory info disabling everything but local directory
** Worry about any remote groups and make them local groups also 
* Then we can log in and start troubleshooting

*Request*
It would be great if JIRA BTF's internal backup facility could just do this, use joost.jar to anonymise a backup on request and send it off to a support issue all in one go - just tick a box "anomonize backup for Atlassian support" and there it is.
fields.summary: Put the support backup Anonymizer into JIRA BTF

  {panel}

It's been found that the Heatmap on the wallboard while filtering on project labels shows entirely different results compared to the project summary screen label Heatmap. 

Note the screenshot, the top browser is the heat map gadget filtering on labels in a project, the word *Corel* is the only large label, then the bottom browser is on the project summary page, note the varying sizes of the labels.

It's been found that the code that produces the algorithm of these two heatmaps is entirely different hence the sizes of the text being rendered inconsistently. Please make these consistent, possibly relying on the project summary algorithm/code over the dashbaord's.

This issue is particularly visible in Projects with multiple Issues where labels (or another value used in the Heatmap) weren't used until a big number of Issues has been created.
fields.summary: JIRA Heatmap gadget code inconsistent algorithm between wallboard and project summary

fields.description:
The following query does not pick up issues in the MYPROJ project, although the reporter has filed multiple issues on that project and those issues are still open:

reporter = "user@domain.com" AND status in (Open, "In Progress", Reopened) AND component != "My Component" AND project != "OTHERPROJ" ORDER BY key ASC

What appears to be happening is JIRA is INCORRECTLY ignoring any project that doesn't have the "My Component" component on it; because it can't exclude the component, it appears to be completely ignoring it.
fields.summary: When a component is specified in a JQL not clause (i.e., !=), JQL will only search projects that do not include that component

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29154].
  {panel}

If proper configuration and documentation is done, an administrator should never be locked out of their JIRA instance's web interface. The reality is that mistakes happen and this is actually a fairly common scenario.

The common workaround to this problem is to use the steps mentioned here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Retrieving+the+JIRA+Administrator

This is a fairly complicated process, and is dangerous because it requires direct database modifications. Additionally, enterprise organizations may have a separate JIRA administrator and database administrator. This results in a longer, drawn out, access and modification request process. 

Google Analytics shows 10,323 page views (see image) for the above mentioned document in the last year alone. A search on SAC for the document brings up 310 support tickets (I am not saying it was absolutely useful in each ticket, just what came up in a search for the url). This procedure is also frequently used internally by support engineers when dealing with customer data.

In other products I have worked on, there has been an easy to use backdoor feature. 

It is important for the backdoor to natively verify a certain level of access permissions before it is triggered. 

I propose that we add a parameter to the jira-config.properties file along the lines of:
{code}
jira.backdoor = 0
{code}

To enable, you would simply set it to 1, and restart the JIRA instance.

This would be read at the time of JIRA starting and would disable all authentication directories within JIRA, and attach a single directory with a preconfigured user and password. This directory would not be editable (or can be generated at boot time, so modifications do not persist). 

By placing this option in the configuration file, we are verifying that:

# The user has access to the server running the instance
# The user's level of access allows them to write changes to the jira-config.properties file
# The user's level of access allows them to restart services / applications

This would also serve as a first step towards providing a solution to JRA-1924
fields.summary: Backdoor administrative access via configuration files

  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Filtering for active and inactive users has been available in Atlassian Cloud for some time.

We do not expect that we will re-implement this feature for JIRA Server at any point in the future, therefore we have made the decision to close this issue.

If you are using JIRA Server right now, there are a couple options:
# You can use the JIRA REST API to return active users, inactive users, or both using the {{/rest/api/2/user/search}} resource and the {{includeActive}} and {{includeInactive}} query paratmers
# You can query the JIRA database directly [as described here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Search+for+Inactive+Users]
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

*Original request description (original description was blank, so let's use one of the duplicates' description for clarity):*
I suggest to add another combo box to Filter Users section, which allows filtering the list by users' statuses (all/active/inactive).
fields.summary: Filter out inactive users in the Users list

fields.description:
When I create an issue, I can't use the lift bar to go through project list.
As soon as I click on the slider, it closes the list.
I have to navigate through the list with the arrow key.

When users create an issue, they can't use the lift bar to go through project list. as soon as they click on the slider, it closes the list. 

The only current workaround is to navigate through the list of projects using the arrow key. 

Attached screen cast showing the behaviour in JAC.
fields.summary: When clicking on the slider of 'Project' field to go through the list of projects, it closes the list in IE9.

fields.description:
h5. Symptom

When attempting to index JIRA, it fails with a RuntimeException that is caused by a NoSuchMethodError.

The following may be found within {{atlassian-jira.log}}:

{noformat}
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.DateTimeRangeSearcher.<init>(Lcom/atlassian/jira/security/JiraAuthenticationContext;Lcom/atlassian/jira/jql/operand/JqlOperandResolver;Lcom/atlassian/jira/util/velocity/VelocityRequestContextFactory;Lcom/atlassian/jira/config/properties/ApplicationProperties;Lcom/atlassian/velocity/VelocityManager;Lcom/atlassian/jira/web/action/util/CalendarLanguageUtil;Lcom/atlassian/jira/jql/util/JqlDateSupport;Lcom/atlassian/jira/issue/customfields/searchers/transformer/CustomFieldInputHelper;Lcom/atlassian/jira/timezone/TimeZoneManager;Lcom/atlassian/jira/datetime/DateTimeFormatterFactory;)V
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.FutureResult.await(FutureResult.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.CompositeResultBuilder$CompositeResult.await(CompositeResultBuilder.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexAll(DefaultIndexManager.java:286)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.util.profiling.object.ObjectProfiler.profiledInvoke(ObjectProfiler.java:81)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:28)
	at $Proxy115.reIndexAll(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.reIndexAll(CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.doReindex(ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.call(AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.call(AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.java:23)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:359)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.multitenant.impl.DefaultMultiTenantManager.runForTenant(DefaultMultiTenantManager.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.multitenant.juc.MultiTenantExecutors$WrappedRunnable.run(MultiTenantExecutors.java:160)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:249)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
	...
Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.DateTimeRangeSearcher.<init>(Lcom/atlassian/jira/security/JiraAuthenticationContext;Lcom/atlassian/jira/jql/operand/JqlOperandResolver;Lcom/atlassian/jira/util/velocity/VelocityRequestContextFactory;Lcom/atlassian/jira/config/properties/ApplicationProperties;Lcom/atlassian/velocity/VelocityManager;Lcom/atlassian/jira/web/action/util/CalendarLanguageUtil;Lcom/atlassian/jira/jql/util/JqlDateSupport;Lcom/atlassian/jira/issue/customfields/searchers/transformer/CustomFieldInputHelper;Lcom/atlassian/jira/timezone/TimeZoneManager;Lcom/atlassian/jira/datetime/DateTimeFormatterFactory;)V
	at com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting.searchers.FirstResponseDateSearcher.<init>(FirstResponseDateSearcher.java:24)
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Unknown Source)
	at org.picocontainer.defaults.InstantiatingComponentAdapter.newInstance(InstantiatingComponentAdapter.java:100)
	at org.picocontainer.defaults.ConstructorInjectionComponentAdapter.instantiateComponent(ConstructorInjectionComponentAdapter.java:200)
	at org.picocontainer.defaults.InstantiatingComponentAdapter.getComponentInstance(InstantiatingComponentAdapter.java:48)
	at org.picocontainer.defaults.DecoratingComponentAdapter.getComponentInstance(DecoratingComponentAdapter.java:42)
	at org.picocontainer.defaults.SynchronizedComponentAdapter.getComponentInstance(SynchronizedComponentAdapter.java:35)
	at org.picocontainer.defaults.DecoratingComponentAdapter.getComponentInstance(DecoratingComponentAdapter.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.ProfilingComponentAdapter.getComponentInstance(ProfilingComponentAdapter.java:45)

{noformat}

h5. Cause

There is a problem with the UPM (see [UPM-2450|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/UPM-2450]) where it is not recognising the latest version for the charting plugin - the current plugin version is incompatible with JIRA 5.1.1.

h5. Resolution

Upgrade the plugin manually by downloading it from the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting] and installing it with the [Universal Plugin Manager|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+JIRA's+Plugins#ManagingJIRAsPlugins-Installingapluginmanually].
fields.summary: JIRA Charting Plugin is causing indexing to fail with a NoSuchMethodError

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29129].
  {panel}

When using the Windows Installer, it does not set the {{%JAVA_HOME%}} system variable. If a user tries to use the [JIRA Configuration Tool|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+JIRA+Configuration+Tool] they will then need to set that variable as in [setting JAVA_HOME|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+Java#InstallingJava-2SettingJAVAHOME].

h5. To replicate

# Download and install JIRA using the Windows Installer.
# Check if the variable has been set as in [setting JAVA_HOME|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+Java#InstallingJava-2SettingJAVAHOME].
# Attempt to the {{config.bat}} tool.

h5. To workaround

Set the {{%JAVA_HOME%}} as in [setting JAVA_HOME|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+Java#InstallingJava-2SettingJAVAHOME].
fields.summary: Windows Installer does not set %JAVA_HOME% to the bundled JRE
Request underscores or other delimiter be officially supported in project keys.

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

JIRA will generate an error when trying to fetch a large number of change groups. This can happen when:
# Fetching change history for a large number of issues.
# Fetching change history for issues with a lot of change groups.

The following can be found within the {{atlassian-jira.log}}:

{noformat:title=SQL Server}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID, groupid, FIELDTYPE, FIELD, OLDVALUE, OLDSTRING, NEWVALUE, NEWSTRING FROM dbo.changeitem WHERE (groupid IN (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ...)
(Prepared or callable statement has more than 2000 parameter markers.)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findByAnd(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:120)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.changehistory.ChangeHistoryBatch.fetchAllChangeItems(ChangeHistoryBatch.java:160)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.changehistory.ChangeHistoryBatch.access$400(ChangeHistoryBatch.java:39)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.changehistory.ChangeHistoryBatch$BatchingChangeHistory.getChangeItems(ChangeHistoryBatch.java:272)
{noformat}

{noformat:title=Oracle}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID, groupid, FIELDTYPE, FIELD, OLDVALUE, OLDSTRING, NEWVALUE, NEWSTRING FROM changeitem WHERE (groupid IN (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ...)
(ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findByAnd(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:120) 
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.changehistory.ChangeHistoryBatch.fetchAllChangeItems(ChangeHistoryBatch.java:160)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.changehistory.ChangeHistoryBatch.access$400(ChangeHistoryBatch.java:39)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.changehistory.ChangeHistoryBatch$BatchingChangeHistory.getChangeItems(ChangeHistoryBatch.java:272)
{noformat}

h3. Cause

The {{ChangeHistoryBatch}} can build SELECT statements with excessively large IN clauses in JIRA 5.1, leading to errors in Activity Streams, GreenHopper, and other plugins that use the {{ChangeHistoryManager}}.

h3. Workaround

There is no current workaround at this stage.
fields.summary: ChangeHistoryBatch.fetchAllChangeItems() fails due to large SQL IN clause

fields.description:
After changes for JRA-26083 it's possible to load 2000 versions in seconds, the table is slow but responsive and it's possible to manage versions in Chrome and Firefox.

Unfortunately the performance is still bad in IE8 (especially) and IE9. Raised this issue to track it. Manage Versions still requires improvements.
Check JRA-26083 for details.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a project with 1,000+ versions
2. In IE10, Navigate to Manage Versions in project config
3. Script Error
fields.summary: Make it possible to manage large versions lists in IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29103].
  {panel}

We get quite a large number of support cases where customers are asking for the steps to take to upgrade from a 3.x instance to our latest version. I usually bounce the following information, however it seems like we should add it to our documentation. I would normally provide them with the following:

{quote}
Prior to upgrading, it's recommended to review the [Production Releases|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Production+Releases] page. If you take a look at all the major release notes it will provide a list of all the new features you'll receive as part of the various upgrades. Please take a look at the [Supported Platforms|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] page for 5.x, particularly the browser support. We recommend Chrome or Firefox to access JIRA, however if you are restricted to Internet Explorer within your organisation please ensure that your users will have access to IE8 at the minimum prior to upgrading. If possible, using IE9 would be preferred.

To upgrade from JIRA 3.x to 5.x, you would need to do this upgrade in two steps. First 3.x to 4.4.5 and then 4.4.5 to 5.x - it's done this way as 5.x is only backwards compatible up to JIRA 4.0.x. To upgrade, please follow the below version specific documentation

* 3.x to 4.4.5: [Migrating JIRA to Another Server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server].
* 4.4.5 to 5.x: [Migrating JIRA to Another Server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA050/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server].

(i) There is a lot of important information in these guides, please ensure everything is followed.

As advised in the [Backing Up|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server#MigratingJIRAtoAnotherServer-2BackingUpr] section you will need to transfer the database contents (via XML), the home directory and the attachments to the new server.  I imagine you will want to do a fair amount of testing on the new version - depending on how long this takes you may need to transfer the information twice, due to changes in the production database between the time the backup was made and the time testing was completed.

One of the *most important* tasks to do during the upgrade will be [migrating the existing JIRA configuration over to the new one|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server#MigratingJIRAtoAnotherServer-34MigrateyourexistingJIRAconfigurationsovertoyournewJIRAinstallation] when upgrading between 3.x and 4.4.5. This is particularly important, especially if you have any custom configurations in JIRA or you're using integration with Active Directory. As of JIRA 4.3, Crowd has been integrated into JIRA, enabling synchronisation with Active Directory/LDAP servers a lot easier. Please have a look at our [Configuring User Directories|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Configuring+User+Directories] documentation if you're using LDAP/AD.

If you have any customisations to JIRA or internally developed plugins, it's recommended to get JIRA up and running successfully prior to installing any additional plugins or making customisations. As discussed in the migration guide, please ensure to check your plugins are compatible with the new version. As part of JIRA 4.3 there is also a [New Plugin Management System|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/JIRA+4.3+Release+Notes#JIRA43ReleaseNotes-NewPluginManagementSystem] and any customised plugins may have to be set up manually, depending on what version they are.

One common error is that when upgrading, some of your plugins may not be compatible with the new version of JIRA and this will generate some errors. If this does happen, please disable those plugins, or remove them from {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} and install them through the [Universal Plugin Manager|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+JIRA?+Plugins#ManagingJIRAsPlugins-InstallingaJIRAPlugin] after you have performed the initial upgrade.
{quote}

Can you please add a page to CAC that has some information on big upgrades, such as 3.x to 5.x? Thanks :)
fields.summary: Add documentation for large upgrades - e.g.: 3.x to 5.x

fields.description:
It looks like the implementation of com.atlassian.jira.user.preferences.DefaultUserPreferenceManager changed between 5.0 and 5.1 and the 5.1 version now uses a com.google.common.cache.Cache instead of org.apache.commons.collections.map.LRUMap. This has changed the key for cache from the com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api.User.getName() to com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api.User. The API for UserPreferencesManager still takes a String instead of a com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api.User for the clearCache(String username) method.


The only option now is to use clearCache() method but that clears the entire cache.

The UserPreferencesManager API needs to be updated.
fields.summary: com.atlassian.jira.user.preferences.UserPreferenceManager.clearCache(String username) no longer works

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29096].
  {panel}

We are using JIRA as an e-mail conversation logger.

A client sends to an address and an issue is created. 

A team is informed of the new e-mail (special velocity template makes it look like a "pure" e-mail from the client - Only the Subject is restricted by JIRA)

All replies from any of the team to the client gets logged and the entire team is informed on comments or updates (one is generated if there is no attachment and the 2nd is generated in case of attachment).

We have changed the velocity files of issuecommented.vm and issueupdated.vm so as to resemble a "pure" e-mail correspondence.

The entire team get all updates and comments, so all members of the team can follow the e-mail conversation between us and the client.

However: Attachments are stored in the ticket and is not forwarded as a notification.

Here is the relevant velocity extract for issuecreated:
#if ( $issue.getProject().getString("key") == "<OUR PROJECT>" )
$!issue.description
#if ($attachments && $attachments.size() >0)
$i18n.getText("template.attachments"): #foreach ($attachment in $attachments)$attachment.getFilename()#if ($velocityCount != $attachments.size()), #end#end
#end

And the e-mail looks like
====
<e-mail text>

Attachments: <attachment name>
====

The attachment goes into the JIRA ticket and all team members need to log in to look at the attachment. 

And if a team member sends an attachment to the client, it gets stripped off and stored in the JIRA ticket and does not reach the client.

My question: Are you looking into making sure there is a way in the velocity file to actually attach the file and make sure the e-mail correspondence is totally transparent in case a correct velocity file is made?

I know that velocity file hacking is not part of your support, but in case it is only a one-liner in the velocity file (text preferably) I would be grateful for this line... ;-) 

Your Client,
  Staffan Ohlsson
  European Synchrotron Radiation Facility, Grenoble France
fields.summary: Allowing JIRA to work as an e-mail exchange logger

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29091].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days.

We've made the decision to close this request. We are focused on improving usability across JIRA – inline editing issues is an important part of JIRA feeling fast and fluid. We would prefer to concentrate our efforts on making the click-to-edit interactions faster, smoother, and more consistent across all areas of the project. Furthermore, adding feature-level behavior configuration on a per-user basis adds significantly more complexity to JIRA and slows down the product for everyone.
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

I just recently noticed the new feature called "Click to edit". While I understand the need to quickly edit a field, I have two problems with this feature:

# Any click on any part of the text triggers this feature. Some people (like me) click on text to select and de-select it (mabye to copy it, or to just make it easier to follow the text while reading), or just to get the focus on the right window. People who do this will most likely end up in edit mode unwantingly (like I have done maybe 10-15 times already today).
# The feature is only configurable on a global level, when each user should be able to configure it individually.

My suggestions is this:

* Make this configuration possible per user.
* Give three configuration options:
*# Full "Click to edit" functionality (as it works now)
*# "Click to edit" using the upper right icon, while any click on the body text does nothing (This one would be my personal favorite)
*# Completely disable "Click to edit"

I don't know what "Affects Version" to select, since we use Jira OnDemand or what's it called.
fields.summary: Feature "Click to edit" should be configurable per user, and in three variations

h3.Summary of The Bug Upgrading JIRA failed during the user management migration with the following message thrown in {{atlassian-jira.log}}: {code} 2012-07-23 23:49:07,154 main INFO [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] ___ Performing Upgrade ____________________ 2012-07-23 23:49:09,212 main INFO [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Performing Upgrade Task: Migrate User Directory configuration 2012-07-23 23:49:09,363 main INFO [jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build601] The following OSUser providers have been detected in the osuser.xml file. 2012-07-23 23:49:09,363 main INFO [jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build601] com.opensymphony.user.provider.ldap.LDAPCredentialsProvider 2012-07-23 23:49:09,363 main ERROR [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Errors during Upgrade Task: Migrate User Directory configuration 2012-07-23 23:49:09,364 main ERROR [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Errors occurred during upgrade: 2012-07-23 23:49:09,364 main ERROR [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Upgrade Error: JIRA is unable to migrate the User Directory configuration because the osuser.xml file does not contain a recognized configuration.
Please see Upgrading JIRA for details.{code} !message.png|thumbnail! h3.Cause of the Bug The cause of the bug is due to {{osuser.xml}} only contain external user management (eg: LDAP) configured on it and no internal repository configured. Example of problematic {{osuser.xml}} {code:XML} com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory ldap://10.60.x.xxx:3268 dc=xxxxxxxx,dc=internal cn CN=xxx,dc=xxxxxxxx,dc=internal xxxxx true {code} h3. Workaround In order to workaround this bug, internal repository configuration needs to be added into the {{osuser.xml}} before re-try the upgrade process: {code:XML} com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory ldap://10.60.x.xxx:3268 dc=xxxxxxxx,dc=internal cn CN=xxx,dc=xxxxxxxx,dc=internal xxxxx true true true true {code}
fields.summary: Upgrade Failed due to Internal Directory is excluded from osuser.xml

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29069].
{panel}
h4. +Summary+

Currently "/rest/api/latest/user/search" API does not return all users if search string is *blank*:
 * /rest/api/latest/user/search?username=

h4. +Notes+

In various environments, it has been observed that setting username to one of the following characters will do the trick:
 * /rest/api/latest/user/search?username="" (double quotes)
 * /rest/api/latest/user/search?username='' (single quotes)
 * /rest/api/latest/user/search?username=. (dot)
 * /rest/api/latest/user/search?username=% (percent)
 * /rest/api/latest/user/search?username=_ (underscore)

Also, *maxResults* and *startAt* seem to be functioning.

(/) For example, in JIRA 7.3, the following calls will return 5 users starting from the 3rd user in the list:
 * [http://localhost:8730/jira/rest/api/latest/user/search?username=""&maxResults=5&startAt=2|http://localhost:8730/jira/rest/api/latest/user/search?username=%22%22&maxResults=5&startAt=2]
 * [http://localhost:8730/jira/rest/api/latest/user/search?username=''&maxResults=5&startAt=2|http://localhost:8730/jira/rest/api/latest/user/search?username=%27%27&maxResults=5&startAt=2]
 * [http://localhost:8730/jira/rest/api/latest/user/search?username=.&maxResults=5&startAt=2]

(i) Replace [http://localhost:8730/jira] with actual Base URL

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29067].
  {panel}

I recently ran up JIRA 5.1 from scratch and was mightly impressed with the startup times, the auto login and then the welcome screen to invite me to create a project.

But as soon as I press the button I get web sudo-ed.  Boooo.

We have already "cheated" and auto logged in so why do we web sudo them?  

Can we not set web sudo off for the next 20 minutes say or detect if there is 1 user on the system and hence there are in eval stage?

It defeats the whole welcome experience.

fields.description:
Found here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5425

GreenHopper was using a Date Time Picker provided by JIRA to capture input for start and end dates of a sprint. We disabled the text box because we don't want users to manually type the information (or remove it).

Since JIRA 5.1, clicking the calendar icon throws an exception, which GreenHopper displays in the big red box.

For our sake, it would be better if this was handled more gracefully. But also for other plugin developers. AFAICT, despite this bug, the control still allows users to change the date.

Disable click to enter Inline Edit for Description field only. User can only enter inline editing by clicking on the pen icon

fields.description:
+Steps to reproduce:+

* Create new project
* Note that it is associated with the default workflow
* Edit the default workflow (the system copies it to a new one for you)
* Make changes to the workflow from the text view (e.g. remove all transitions to In Progress status)
* Publish the workflow
* Check the Diagram (Workflow Designer View); *BUG*: your changes should be shown but they are not

+Note:+
If you have an issue in _In Progress_ status (and then you edit your workflow) you will indeed see that you cannot transition it. So the workflow is actually active, *you just do not see your changes in the diagram*. Other than that, the workflow seems to work just fine.
fields.summary: Workflow changes not shown in Workflow Designer (Diagram button)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-29059].
  {panel}

The ATR creates 1 velocity engine per plugin. Each one of these has a fixed-size pool of 20 parsers that end up using a lot of memory.

We should try to reduce this. One option is to plug in a different pool implementation for the parser pools (they are pluggable).

The holy grail would be to reuse 1 Velocity engine across all plugins (actually, one for velocity 1.5 and another for 1.6). Don't know if this is possible but it should be!

To go back to the old behaviour on 5.1.x, pass -Datr.velocity.fixed.size.pool=true as a JVM system property
fields.summary: Atlassian Template Renderer's memory usage too high
